IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Dohn Community High School is a multi-campus non-profit school serving high school age and adult students. We deliver continuous progress to a full-spectrum of learning needs. We promote community engagement social development and career fulfillment following graduation.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Dohn Community High School is a multi-campus non-profit school serving high school age and adult students. We deliver continuous progress to a full-spectrum of learning needs. We promote community engagement social development and career fulfillment following graduation.
IRS990.Desc: State aid provided to the school to aid in the development and teaching of 1,479 FTE high school students at the school. The school receives the majority of their funding 98.5% from state and federal grants based on the number of FTE requirements.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: The school is participating in the Ohio Department of Education program that allows adults 22 and over the ability to earn a diploma. For fiscal year 2022 the school was able to serve over 946 adult students.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The statement is published on the School's website and promotional material sent out.
The School receives the majority of their funding through state and federal grants.
The School works with a management company for operation of the School. The main administrative official is an employee of the management company.

The School Board has the ability to create subgroups such as the Finance Committee that reviews information before the full board reviews it. Those committees cannot act on behalf of the full School Board.
The School Director and Treasurer review the form and provide it for Board review. The form was provided for the February meeting to review before submission.
The School follows up with Board Members annually to determine if any conflicts exist under the policy and whether subsequent action should occur.

The School evaluated the time necessary for key employee functions and management duties required. The School examined other Schools in similar environments along with management responsibilities for the pay status of their key employees.

The School maintains all governing documents policies and financial reports in the administrative office. Any person can request this information through a public information request to the School. Some of these items are maintained on the School websites; therefore those items would not need a public information request.

The Board is provided a copy of the audit and communication related to the audit process. When the 990 was filed the audit report was not completed but the compilation report was filed in November 2022.
The School was in the process of being audited for the fiscal year when the 990 was submitted. The audit wasn't completed at the time.
